oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Military commission of Captain Halbert S. Rogers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Militia commission of Halbert S. Rogers of Hawkins County, Tenn., as Captain, Company L, Eighth Regiment of Tennessee Cavalry. The commission is signed by Governor Andrew Johnson, March 1, 1865, and also carries the signature of Edward H. East, Secretary of State.

The Eighth Tennessee Cavalry was created by the consolidation of the Tenth East Tennessee Cavalry, an incomplete regiment, with the Eighth, by order of Gov. Andrew Johnson in February 1864. The regiment continued to bear the name of the Eighth Cavalry. Col. S.K.N. Patton was assigned to the command, assuming his post in April 1864.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Johnson, Andrew, 1808-1875; Tennessee. Governor; Tennessee. Militia; Hawkins County (Tenn.); United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
